timeline.bodyText: Lets add a short description so other people know what this class does.

timeline.bodyText: We can just return the newly created object.

timeline.bodyText: Maybe we can make the switch a member variable. I dont think we need to create a new one for every getInstanceFor call.

timeline.bodyText: Test class doesnt seem to be registered in all tests?

timeline.bodyText:
Do we need to setup enum values for the test case?
If not lets remove this to keep it simple.

timeline.bodyText:
Rather than an instanceof check here I think we can use an equals check. E.g.
assertEquals(vpi, beanPropertyFloat.getTypeInstance());

timeline.bodyText:
I think testing only one property bean is enough.
We just need to test here that the bean independence solver actually handles properties.
That the individual types are handled correctly is tested in the bean factory.
timeline.author: SaMuellerDLR

timeline.bodyText:
Double check if we need this much setupfor the bean property test.
Why is the ca test so simple but the property test looks so complex?

timeline.bodyText: Please improve comments, it is ahrd to understand which uuid is the SEI and which one is the BO and so on. mabye consider using the comments in the assert statements as well. This makes it easier to spot the exact place and reason once a test case is failing.
